level.heading: JURISDICTION AND DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY FOR ADMINISTRATIVE HEARINGS (§0-4304)

level.text: In every case brought pursuant to this chapter in which an administrative hearing is requested or otherwise required, the Director hereby delegates his or her hearing authority to the District of Columbia Office of Administrative Hearings (OAH), which shall have jurisdiction to adjudicate and render a final administrative decision in a contested case.
The Director shall pursue administrative enforcement actions through:
Notices of violation, threat, or release pursuant to § 4305;
Notices of violation, threat, or release, combined with an immediate compliance order or cease and desist order pursuant to § 4307;
Proposed modification, suspension, proposed revocation, or revocation of a permit or approval pursuant to § 4308;
Notices of violation and administrative sanctions under the Illegal Dumping Enforcement Act pursuant to § 4312;
Cost recovery under the Illegal Dumping Enforcement Act pursuant to § 4314.6; and
Any other enforcement action authorized by law.
